newsitem.title: USA: AIG finalises Golden Eagle deal with Calif.
newsitem.headline: AIG finalises Golden Eagle deal with Calif.

text.p: California's insurance commissioner said on Monday he finalised an agreement for American International Group Inc to take over Golden Eagle Insurance Co.

Golden Eagle, one of the largest writers of workers compensation insurance in California, was seized by the state Department of Insurance in late January because of allegations of a reserve shortfall.
In April, American International Group (AIG) won the bidding for Golden Eagle and began working with the commissioner in preparation for taking over the company.
In a statement on Monday, California Insurance Commissioner Chuck Quackenbush said he had reached a final agreement with AIG. The terms of the deal were not disclosed.

AIG is expected to establish a new company, to be named San Diego Casualty Co, to carry on the business. Golden Eagle wrote about $400 million of workers compensation and $300 million of property-casualty business in 1996.
Quackenbush said he expected San Francisco Superior Court Judge William Cahill to review the agreement within the next 30 to 45 days.
"It is important to take care of this matter as soon as possible to safeguard Golden Eagle's policyholders and employees," Quackenbush said.
